content.text:
# 2017 Empire Slovak Open – Singles

Markéta Vondroušová
| runner   =  Verónica Cepede Royg
| score    = 7–5, 7–6(7–3)
| type    = singles doubles
| before_name = Empire Slovak Open – Singles
| after_name = Empire Slovak Open – Singles
}}
Kateřina Siniaková was the defending champion, but chose to participate at the 2017 Internazionali BNL d'Italia instead.
Markéta Vondroušová won the title, defeating Verónica Cepede Royg in the final, 7–5, 7–6(7–3).
Seeds
Yanina Wickmayer (quarterfinals)
#  Evgeniya Rodina (second round; withdrew)
#  Ekaterina Alexandrova (semifinals; retired)
#  Kurumi Nara (quarterfinals)
#  Verónica Cepede Royg (final)
#  Markéta Vondroušová (champion)
#  Heather Watson (quarterfinals)
#  Danka Kovinić (first round; retired)
}}
